name: Horizon Walker
description: Horizon Walkers protect the mortal realm from otherworldly threats, keeping watch over planar portals and traveling between planes to combat dangers that arise from beyond the material world.

horizon_walker_magic.description: At 3rd level, you gain access to additional spells that help you guard against planar threats.

detect_portal.description: At 3rd level, you can sense the presence of planar portals.

details.ability: As an action, you detect the distance and direction to the closest planar portal within 1 mile.
details.rest_requirement: Once used, you can't use this feature again until you finish a short or long rest.

planar_warrior.description: At 3rd level, you can channel multiversal energy to enhance your attacks.

details.bonus_action: As a bonus action, choose one creature you can see within 30 feet.
details.force_damage: The next time you hit that creature with a weapon attack, all damage dealt becomes force damage.
details.extra_damage: The creature takes an extra 1d8 force damage (increases to 2d8 at 11th level).

ethereal_step.description: At 7th level, you can temporarily step into the Ethereal Plane.

details.bonus_action: As a bonus action, cast Etherealness without expending a spell slot.
details.duration: The spell ends at the end of the current turn.
details.rest_requirement: You can't use this feature again until you finish a short or long rest.

distant_strike.description: At 11th level, you can teleport short distances between attacks.

details.teleportation: When you use the Attack action, you can teleport up to 10 feet before each attack.
details.additional_attack: If you attack at least two different creatures, you can make one additional attack against a third creature.

spectral_defense.description: At 15th level, you can use your planar movement to reduce damage.

details.reaction_to_damage: When you take damage from an attack, use your reaction to gain resistance to all of that attack's damage for the turn.
